pages.text: Certain photonic components may necessitate interaction with individual tau leptons -- much too small a scale for any conventional equipment to operate on. To this end, the $(2)Tau Condenser$() is capable of creating a high-density environment in which a probabilistic distribution is formed favouring the desired tau states.

pages.title: Condenser Casing
pages.text: The condenser apparatus itself is fairly simple; a frame of reinforced glass provides the means to create an environment isolated from external interference in which the controlled probability field can form.

pages.title: Tau Condenser
pages.text: Finally, the condenser requires an internal reservoir of gaseous tritium, whose low mass-to-neutron ratio allows for the maintenance of a stable probabilistic population inversion.
